🕊️ Cautious Continuationist.description: This church holds that certain spiritual gifts (prophecy, tongues, healing) may continue today but exercises caution and does not see them as normative for all believers.

🔥 Charismatic.description: This church emphasizes the ongoing work of the Holy Spirit through tongues, prophecy, and healing as normative expressions of the Christian life.

📜 Reformed.description: This church identifies with Reformed theology, emphasizing God's sovereignty in salvation (often called the Doctrines of Grace or TULIP).

🍷 Paedocommunion.description: This church allows baptized children (including infants) to partake in the Lord's Supper, a practice held by some Presbyterian and Reformed congregations.

🧭 Arminian.description: This church identifies with Arminian soteriology (e.g., conditional election, prevenient grace, resistible grace, and often conditional security).

📖 Expository Preaching.description: This church emphasizes verse-by-verse teaching through books of the Bible, seeking to explain and apply Scripture in its context.

🎵 Regulative Principle of Worship.description: This church follows the Regulative Principle, worshiping according to elements explicitly prescribed in Scripture (e.g., prayer, preaching, singing psalms and hymns, sacraments).

🕯️ High Church/Liturgical.description: This church follows a formal liturgy (such as the Book of Common Prayer or Lutheran Service Book), with structured prayers, creeds, and readings.

🤝 Denomination/Network Affiliated.description: This church is a member of a denomination, network, fellowship, or association (e.g., PCA, SBC, ARBCA, FIRE, Acts 29) that provides formal membership, oversight, accountability, cooperative missions, or structured fellowship with like-minded congregations.

🆓 Independent.description: This church operates with complete autonomy, having no formal ties to any denomination, network, fellowship, or association. The church maintains full independence in governance and doctrine without external accountability structures.

🏠 House Church.description: This church meets in homes rather than a dedicated building, often emphasizing intimate fellowship and simple worship.

🏢 Multi-Site.description: This church operates multiple campuses or locations under one leadership structure.

👥 Small Church.description: This church has a stated membership or attendance under 100, often providing close-knit fellowship and personal care.

🏟️ Megachurch.description: This church has a stated membership or attendance over 2,000, typically offering diverse ministries and programs.

⚠️ Prosperity Gospel.description: This church teaches Word of Faith theology or emphasizes guaranteed health and wealth through faith or giving, which departs from biblical teaching on suffering and God's purposes (Romans 8:28-29; 2 Corinthians 12:7-10).

⚠️ Hyper-Charismatic.description: This church emphasizes excessive manifestations (such as 'drunk in the Spirit' or 'grave soaking') or elevates prophecy and experience above Scripture, which conflicts with biblical order (1 Corinthians 14:40; 2 Timothy 3:16-17).

⚠️ Entertainment-Driven.description: This church is marketed primarily as entertainment, with diluted biblical content or a seeker-driven model that minimizes the gospel to attract crowds.

👩‍🏫 Ordained Women.description: This church ordains women as pastors, elders, or teaching authorities over men, a practice we cannot endorse based on Scripture's teaching on church leadership (1 Timothy 2:12-14; 1 Timothy 3:1-7; Titus 1:5-9). This refers specifically to ordained church offices, not women's roles in marriage or other ministry contexts.

🏳️‍🌈 LGBTQ Affirming.description: This church affirms same-sex relationships or gender identity ideology in membership, leadership, or marriage, which departs from Scripture's design for human sexuality and marriage (Genesis 1:27; Genesis 2:24; Romans 1:26-27; 1 Corinthians 6:9-11).

⚠️ Denies Inerrancy of Scripture.description: This church denies biblical inerrancy or treats Scripture as errant, conflicting with Scripture's authority and sufficiency (2 Timothy 3:16; John 10:35).

⚠️ Non-Trinitarian.description: This church denies the Trinity (e.g., oneness/modalism or unitarian beliefs), departing from historic Christian orthodoxy.

⚠️ Works-Based Justification.description: This church teaches or implies justification by works or merit rather than by grace alone through faith alone in Christ alone (Romans 3:28; Galatians 2:16).

⚠️ Universalism.description: This church teaches or implies universal salvation and/or denies final judgment, contradicting Scripture's teaching on judgment and hell (Hebrews 9:27; Matthew 25:46).

⚠️ Open Theism.description: This church denies God's exhaustive foreknowledge, asserting that God does not know the future free decisions of creatures.

⚠️ New Apostolic Reformation (NAR).description: This church embraces modern apostles/prophets with governing authority and ongoing extra-biblical revelation characteristic of NAR.

⚠️ Progressive Christianity.description: This church explicitly aligns with Progressive Christianity or reinterprets core doctrines according to modern ideological frameworks.

⚠️ Religious Pluralism.description: This church affirms multiple valid paths to God or interfaith equivalence, denying the exclusivity of Christ (John 14:6; Acts 4:12).

🔄 Dispensational.description: This church holds a dispensational framework with a distinction between Israel and the Church and often a rapture timeline emphasis.

🧑‍🎓 Wesleyan-Holiness.description: This church teaches entire sanctification/sinless perfection (Holiness/Wesleyan tradition).

🧱 KJV-Only.description: This church treats the King James Version as the only valid English Bible translation for doctrine and practice.

🥖 Real Presence (Lutheran).description: This church explicitly affirms Lutheran real presence/sacramental union in the Lord's Supper.

🎯 Seeker-Sensitive.description: This church prioritizes an explicit seeker model for weekend services (programmatic, attractional), distinct from entertainment-driven excess.

👥 Plurality of Elders.description: This church explicitly practices a plurality of elders in governance.

📘 Membership & Discipline.description: This church maintains formal membership and publishes a church discipline process.

📚 Catechism Use.description: This church actively teaches and uses recognized catechisms for discipleship.

🎶 Exclusive Psalmody.description: This church practices exclusive psalm singing in corporate worship.

🎼 Instrument-Free Worship.description: This church practices a cappella (instrument-free) corporate worship.

🍼 Family-Integrated.description: This church follows a family-integrated model that keeps families together in worship and emphasizes family discipleship.

ℹ️ Minimal Doctrinal Detail.description: Crawl-accessible pages lacked substantive doctrinal detail; site may impede crawling or does not present a published doctrinal statement online.

ℹ️ No Statement of Faith.description: No statement of faith or doctrinal statement was found during crawl (no beliefs/statement-of-faith/confession pages detected).
